item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 - Where to Get Black Arrows
item.description:
There are several weapons in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , including melee and ranged options. The main protagonist, Henry, finds all kinds of trouble as he treks across Bohemia, so having a weapon on hand is a smart move. Bows and Crossbows let players rain death from a distance, but of course, they’re nothing without arrows.

If players use a Bow, Black Arrows are the most powerful and deal the most damage. However, they are rare and only available in a specific area. This guide will show players exactly where to find Black Arrows and how to craft them in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 .

Where to Get Black Arrows in KCD2

Black Arrows are, hands down, one of the best arrow types in KCD2 . They are capable of felling their targets in one hit, so stocking up on them is a good idea for those who favor ranged weapons. While most other arrows can be bought from Blacksmiths, Traders, and Carpenters, Black Arrows are a bit more elusive.

Black Arrows are found in Kuttenberg at the shooting range near Pschitoky, toward the southwest. There, under the shade of a few battered trees and surrounded by worn-out targets, players will find a man named Lefty . Lefty will tell Henry about a special arrow he's been using, one tipped with a raven’s feather, and offer to make some if brought the right materials.

Players need Raven, or Rook, Feathers to make Black Arrows. Feathers can be picked up from nests. Nests are marked on players' maps once discovered, and can be knocked out of their trees with a stone or an arrow. This can be difficult at times, but luckily, there are a few Black Arrows nearby that Henry can pick up.

Around Lefty’s range, there are several Black Arrows already stuck in the targets. Good news: Lefty doesn't mind if players help themselves, so take them all. Players can recover arrows shot into enemies; rob or loot them after battle to pull the arrow from their corpses. The same goes for hunting animals: butcher them after the kill, and the arrows are tucked inside.

If players need more, they can bring him some feathers, and he'll make them.

Tips for Shooting Bows and Crossbows in KCD2

Players can build weapon proficiencies that make using weapons easier and give them stronger attacks. Ranged weapons can be tricky to use when first starting, but with practice and other resources, Bows and Crossbows become very powerful.

Aiming Bows and Crossbows uses up tons of stamina. Players should increase their Marksmanship stat, and Henry won't shake as much.

Those on PC can use a cheat to make their aiming dot reticle always on for better accuracy when shooting.

Players can increase Marksmanship by doing the following:

  • Shooting bandits
  • Hunting animals
  • Visiting Shooting ranges
  • Reading Skill books

For a temporary boost to Marksmanship, Henry can drink a Bowman's Brew potion. The recipe can be picked up from the trader Barnaby near Trosky. Marksmanship also comes into play when players use Firearms, which are especially hard to use in combat.

Like other skills in KCD2 , Marksmanship has Perks that give Henry buffs and advantages when using ranged weapons.

Best Perks for Marksmanship

Perk (Category)

Description

Steady Aim (Marksmanship)

If you don't move for two or more seconds while aiming, your stamina will drain 20% slower, and your shot will be 15% stronger.

Salvo (Marksmanship)

After each shot, you get a short-term buff during which you reload and aim faster. So you can also shoot faster, and if you do it in time, you'll regain the buff with each shot.

Crippling Shot (Marksmanship)

If you deal damage to an enemy with a ranged weapon, their stamina will recover more slowly, and their combat ability will be reduced.

Forbidden Weapon (Marksmanship)

If you inflict a bleeding wound on an opponent with a crossbow bolt, bleeding will be faster and stronger, so they will weaken or die sooner.

One Shot at Glory (Marksmanship)

If you kill an enemy with a ranged weapon, your next shot will deal 50 % more damage.

12 Images
12 Images

item.title: Avowed: Should You Help Amadio? (Nature vs. Nurture)
item.description:
"Nature vs Nurture" is one of several side-quests found in Avowed 's Emerald Stair region. You'll find the quest fairly early if you explore the area outside Fior mes Iverno when you first reach the region. Like many of the side-quests in Avowed, "Nature vs. Nurture" presents you with a difficult choice. A common theme throughout the game is the question of whether Xaurips – especially the non-violent factions – are actually 'monsters'? At first glance, the quest seems to present a fairly straightforward problem, but as you investigate further, the "correct" outcomes become less and less obvious. Here, we'll provide you with a complete guide to Avowed 's "Nature vs. Nurture" side quest , and do our best to answer whether you should help Amadio or the farmers .

Nature vs. Nurture Video Walkthrough – Avowed

How to Begin Nature vs. Nurture in Avowed

Visit the Animancy Farmers – Dolina & Masco Laima:

To begin the " Nature vs. Nurture " side quest in Avowed, you'll need to visit the Animancy Farmers who claim they are being harmed by a group of Xaurips. To find these farmers – whose names are Dolina and Masco Laima – head northeast from the Farmer's Market, past the massive root that rises from the field. You'll come across a small cabin in a grove of trees. This is where you'll begin "Nature vs. Nurture."

After explaining that a group of Xaurips have taken their farming equipment, Dolina and Masco will task the Envoy with locating the Xaurip's camp, and solving the problem for good. If you check the map, you'll find that the Xaurip camp is far to the north, just past the end of the river that runs vertically through the center of the region.

Visiting the Xaurip Camp in Nature vs. Nurture – Avowed

Stay Your Blade:

As previously mentioned, the camp you are looking for is near the northernmost point in Emerald Stair . The region you are trying to reach is called the Grim Wetlands, due to its dark and swampy nature. The Fortified Xaurip Camp is found to the northwest of the Moldering Godless Ruins , on the eastern edge of the Grim Wetlands.

Once you reach the camp, you'll find that it is very clearly defined by its fences. You are safe to attack the many Xaurips outside the fence, but if you want to have the option to settle this quest peacefully, you should absolutely avoid attacking any of the Xaurips within the Fortified Xaurip Camp .

Your task inside the camp is to locate Amadio, the hermit that seems to hold some kind of power over these Xaurips. To find him, you'll need to use the wooden platforms that lead to the rock wall at the back of the camp. Follow the path up the rocks, and you'll find the entrance to a cave that is also labeled as the Fortified Xaurip Camp. Enter the cave and approach Amadio at the back. This is where the quest's major choice occurs.

Should You Help or Kill Amadio the Hermit in Nature vs. Nurture – Avowed

I'm Like, Just Trying to Help, Man:

When you speak to Amadio, he reveals that he believes that the animancers are "poisoning the land," and in turn, causing the Dreamscourge. Because of this, he is using the Xaurips to attack farms that use Animancy, destroying their equipment, and doing his part to help nature fight back. Unfortunately, how he gains control over the Xaurips is never directly addressed.

Amadio asks you to convince the farmers to call off the rangers, which will allow him to continue his wave of conservation by vandalism. You have the option to ask your companions for their opinions, and how they react will differ greatly depending on who is in your party. The gist is as follows:

  • Marius, as a character who is already skeptical of animancy to begin with, will encourage you to help Amadio.
  • Giatta, as an animancer, thinks Amadio is out of his mind.

Choosing to Help Amadio:

If you decide to help the hermit Amadio, you must return to Dolina and Masco, and convince them to call off the rangers. The scenario plays out thusly:

  • If you tell them the truth, they will call off the rangers, but they will not be happy at all. You will not receive any reward from the farmers.
  • If you choose to Lie, the farmers will call off the rangers because they believe there is no reason to keep them on the case. They will reward you with the Ring of Pain Amplification and some skeyt.

You'll then need to return to Amadio , who will now be standing in the center of camp outside the cave. Speak to him, and he will reward you with the Wolf Boots .

Choosing to Help Dolina and Masco Laima:

If you decide not to side with the farmers, or simply do not like Amadio, you can either attack him when the prompt appears during the initial conversation, or, if you change your mind after choosing to help him, you can return any time before speaking to the farmers and let him know you will not be helping. Both options will lead to Amadio and the entire camp of Xaurips becoming hostile.

Should you decide to fight Amadio and his Xaurip army, make sure that you are fully prepared for a tough fight. The fight will be much easier if you wait until you have your favorite Unique Weapon upgraded to the Exceptional tier.

Once the fight is over, you can loot the Wolf Boots from Amadio's dead body. Upon returning to the farmers, you'll receive the Ring of Pain Amplification and skeyt.

Which Option is Best?

In terms of rewards, both choices have a path to collecting all possible rewards, so in that sense it is hard to say that any one option is better. However, once you have completed the game, there is a detail that leads us to believe one of the choices in this quest is technically better. We refer to the fact that, technically, Amadio is wrong. The animancers are absolutely not to blame for the Dreamscourge, and while we will not spoil the ultimate cause, we feel can assert that he is wrong with 100% confidence.

Whether Amadio deserves to die for this mistake is another question entirely, but he is using one group of innocent Xaurips to punish a group of innocent animancers. If there is a villain in this quest, it is Amadio. Whether intentional or not, he is causing the most pain. If it helps, you will earn far more XP for taking out the Xaurip camp, so that should provide an added incentive for choosing to help the farmers in " Nature vs. Nurture "

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games With Cosmic Horror, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Prey (2006) by Human Head Studios offers innovative gameplay, dark setting, and eldritch alien enemies.
  • Dishonored features a gaslight-fantasy world, an Eldritch Entity, and player choices shaping the game's outcome.
  • Bloodborne by FromSoftware combines cosmic horror with gothic elements, captivating players with its eerie atmosphere.

Open-world games often offer certain extra layers of quality brought to the players through their setting, their worldbuilding, and most importantly, their mechanics. And when the developers decide to casually drop Cosmic Horror elements into the mix, then players are bound for some gruesome, mind-boggling experiences.

So, for those fans of eldritch horror, this ranked list spotlights the best Open-World games with cosmic horror elements. From one of the most underrated sci-fi survival horrors to a game that puts the 'N' in the word niche, but has thousands of fans all across the world.

8 Prey

One Of The Most Underrated Cosmic Horror Sci-Fi Games

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Prey (2006)
FPS
Systems
Released
July 11, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

The original Prey game, made by Human Head Studios, was one of the most innovative Sci-Fi shooters of its time. Immersed in a dark and eerie setting, the players need to survive an alien invasion inside a Cherokee reservation and then take the fight to their mothership using a series of portals. The aliens are as ugly as they can get: an amalgamation of anthropomorphic eldritch horrors, animals, and mutated zombies that will make the player's guts churn and their minds break.

One of the most notorious survival elements in this game is its many gravitational shifts and transversal movement using portals, which are a precursor of many other games that followed the same game design patterns. Still, what turns the whole experience into a Cosmic Horror story is the background of the invader aliens called Hunters, and their connection with the Spiritual Realm, which is a key component in the setting.

7 Dishonored

An Eldritch Entity Offers You Her Heart, And You Accepted?

Your comment has not been saved

Dishonored
9 /10
9.5 /10
Released
October 9, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language
Powered by

Dishonored is one of the creepiest and coolest games; that's undeniable. For starters, the setting transports the players into a gaslight-fantasy universe where sword and sorcery are as grim as they can get. Then, when players believe everything is chill and they're part of nobility, a wild murder plot to slay the Empress leaves Corvo Atano running for his dear life as the main suspect of the magnicide.

After that comes some bargaining with an Eldritch Entity named the Outsider, who gifts Corvo with a Heart (wonder where he got that from) imbued with his power. Then players are free to explore an enormous city using the heart of his beloved Empress to listen to sinister whispers about the city, how it survives on Whale Oil, and the secrets other people hold. Using the power of the Outsider, players can choose to lay low or unleash a bloody revenge, which will determine the shape of the world around them: the more carnage they unleash, the more the plague spreads, the misery floods the streets, and the world becomes more dangerous. A masterpiece.

6 Bloodborne

Deranged Gods, Eldrich Entities Corrupting Everything

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Bloodborne
18
8.9 /10
Released
March 24, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Powered by

A mysterious plague invades the streets, turning its denizens into horrific monstrosities, while a solitary hunter must face the aberrations using all of his skills and a wide array of weapons. Bloodborne is the best open-world game made by FromSoftware, and it has aged incredibly well despite years of being (allegedly) forgotten by its developer.

The setting of the game combines a gaslight Victorian-esque worlbuilding, with gothic and cosmic horror in a perfect and subtle mix that has enthralled countless players. With the recent announcement of The Duskbloods , its spiritual successor, fans of Bloodborne have been quite excited (in both the bad and good sense), so if players have this jewel of the past decade forgotten somewhere around their gaming cabinet, they might want to consider giving it a try once again.

5 Borderlands 2

The Vault Was Closed For A Damn Good Reason

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed
Borderlands 2
Shooter
Systems
8 /10
13
8.8 /10
Released
September 18, 2012
ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Gearbox Software
Publisher(s)
2K

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Though many players believe that Borderlands 2 is only a sci-fi looter shooter, the truth is that its whole story is based on the premise of an ancient alien race who fought tooth and nail to trap sinister galactic horrors into huge vaults, leaving tons of warnings and defenses, who dumb humans, of course, ignored completely.

The worldbuilding of the Vault Hunters and the Sirens is always pointing towards that Cosmic Horror feeling of the unknown, what lies beyond the stars, in the dark corners of the universe. And, of course, once players ignore all the warnings and open the Vault, absolute madness unleashes: a being that is so grotesque that it can barely be recognized as a 'thing.' Luckily for the players, by the time they open Pandora's Box (even the whole planet is a huge warning sign), they will be equipped with tons of powerful weapons to deal with the beast. So have fun monster-slaying!

4 The Sinking City

The Most Lovecraftian Open-World Game You'll Ever See

Your comment has not been saved

The Sinking City
4 /10
7.5 /10
Released
June 27, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

The Sinking City is one of those games that are recommended to play in broad daylight and, if possible, with the lights on. A combination of Cosmic Horror elements with a sinister plot that would make Lovecraft proud, this game was developed by Frogwares and received quite a lot of approval from both the critics and the audience.

Its main attraction is its intriguing plot, which mixes sleuth with psychological horror and makes players think twice before turning down a dark alley to investigate a clue. The map is quite big, though, there are certain elements that distort the flow of the player's movements and make is a little bit linear. Still, it can be considered an open-world game.

3 The Vanishing Of Ethan Carter

Eerie, Sinister, Devoid Of Life

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed
The Vanishing of Ethan Carter

The Vanishing Of Ethan Carter plays with the sense of oppression that exists in huge open spaces that seem to be derelicted magnificiently, making its world look so distant from civilization that it seems to be a pocket dimension. Players might feel the lingering feeling that something is observing their every move, which leads to panic and not knowing what to do.

Not only because there's a huge map to explore and little to no clues (yellow) painted for them to uncover, but because of the supernatural elements that compose its story. The truth is, something dark and powerful has a hold on Red Creek Valley, and players will experience in first person how the events that led to the disappearance of a young boy will forever haunt that remote region of Wisconsin and the lives of all its denizens.

2 Alan Wake II

Mindbreaking, Thrilling, And Panic Inducing

Follow

If the first Alan Wake game was good, the second iteration of the franchise might be a step in the right direction, though it's greatly underrated. Still, one of the best things about the game is that it managed to keep that eerie and mind-distorting ambiance that made the first story a huge success.

That sensation of being transported into a Lovecraftian tale is always there, lingering on the edges of the screen, while players struggle not to feel the oppression of the darkness creeping down upon them. It is an awesome game,

1 Pathologic 2

One Of The Most Gruesome Horror Experiences, Highly Underrated

8 Images
8 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Pathologic 2
9.3 /10
Released
May 23, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Violence
Powered by

Pathologic 2 is a game that transports the players into one of the creepiest and most gut-churning settings in the history of gaming. The game takes place in a remote village of the Russian steppes, where players must live their lives in constant fear, interacting with its strange denizens, trading, bartering, and holding on to their every figment of sanity as reality itself seems to be distorting around them at a fast pace.

The story follows inside a sinister time-loop like structure, breaking the fourth wall for in ways that are both innovative and concerning. With its main character Artemy Burakh, a physician and surgeon who tries to heal not only the residents of that god-forsaken place, but his own mind (somehow) as well. This highly underrated game is so much more than simply cosmic horror in a pocket dimension: it is pure and unbridled dread, coated in a thick layer of madness.

item.title: Cookie Run Kingdom: Pure Vanilla Cookie Build and Best Toppings
item.description:
Healer cookies in Cookie Run Kingdom have one job, and it's to keep the rest of the team alive for as long as possible. Some of the best healer cookies in Cookie Run Kingdom are so overpowered that cookies run little risk of falling out of battle, thanks mostly to the active skills that produce various healing and protective properties. Such is the case for Pure Vanilla Cookie, the Ancient healer of the Vanilla Kingdom, who uses his power to ward off darkness and bring back his allies to safety.

Pure Vanilla Cookie is one of five Ancients, each belonging to a separate class of fighter. As a healer cookie, Pure Vanilla takes its position in the rear, securing its safety and limiting the amount of damage it takes, while allowing him the time needed to burn through the cooldown and use his magical powers to heal his allies. The key to bringing out Pure Vanilla's true power is through properly building her with the correct toppings, Beascuits, and raising her skill power as much as possible.

Updated on April 15, 2025, by Mehrdad Khayyat: Even months after its release, Pure Vanilla Cookie is still the best healer in Cookie Run: Kingdom, helping all squad members significantly to survive devastating attacks, especially when facing bosses.

Pure Vanilla Cookie has been designed in a way that doesn't give players much flexibility in crafting various builds. Since she barely deals any damage and always stands in the farthest line from the enemies, it is usually the defensive buffs that come in handy.

Building Pure Vanilla Cookie For Healing Ability

Due to Pure Vanilla Cookie's main skills, it's important to consider having a Defense cookie paired with him in order to protect his HP at all times. Pure Vanilla will constantly heal all allies and remove any injuries, and follow it up with a shield that equals a percentage of the cookie's maximum HP. Additionally, Pure Vanilla can cast an HP regen on cookies that can not receive a shield upon releasing his skill, which will help replenish any loss of HP prior to the skill's use. During the release of the skill, Pure Vanilla cannot be interrupted but is still prone to taking damage from field enemies.

Gentle And Warm Radiance

  • Amplify Buff: +25.0% for 10.0 sec; stacks up to x1
  • Healing: 112.0% of ATK
  • HP Shield: blocks DMG equal to 20.0% of Max HP for 10.0 sec
  • If the HP Shield is dispelled or the target is immune:
  • Healing (Cookies): 1.0% of Max HP every 1.0 sec for 7.0 sec
  • Healing (Others): 35.0% of ATK every 1.0 sec for 7.0 sec
  • Injury Alleviation: -50.0%

Ancient Cookie

  • Passive: Debuff Resist +30.0%

Solid Almond Topping Build

There are two paths that players can take when considering a topping build for Pure Vanilla Cookie. Ideally, the Solid Almond build is the best choice to make when players consider the DMG Resist buff they can put on Pure Vanilla Cookie. DMG Resist is ideal for minimizing the amount of HP that Pure Vanilla Cookie loses in a battle, and a higher percentage rate will almost guarantee that he remains in play for the entire fight. A plus-five Solid Almond bonus will give an additional 5% on DMG Resist, making it possible to achieve a 20% total boost. Better yet, using a Solid Almond Topping Tart of Epic rarity adds 8% more DMG Resist.

The other build to consider is the all Swift Chocolate set-up, which prioritizes bringing down Pure Vanilla Cookie's cooldown as much as possible. Having a shorter cooldown phase will allow Pure Vanilla Cookie to unleash more heals than usual and keep the high-offense cookies as healthy as they can be. Ideally, players should then target areas that benefit Pure Vanilla Cookie's own health, making DMG Resist and CRIT Resist two ideal sub-stats to focus on.

Swift Chocolate Topping Build

Being a healer that always stands in the back line, Pure Vanilla doesn't even deal much damage to focus on its attacking stats. Instead, the players will probably need to concentrate as much as they can to reduce the cookie's cooldown so that they can benefit from the heals and buffs that he delivers to all other cookies in quick succession.

That's why Swift Chocolate provides a significant advantage for Pure Vanilla to be effective on the battlefield for the entire team. Of course, this build is only suggested if you have high-level toppings of Swift Chocolate; Otherwise, it wouldn't really reduce the cooldown significantly.

Each Epic version of Swift Chocolate reduces the cooldown by 1.8% at the base level. So, even without a topping upgrade, five Epic Swift Chocolates will reduce the cooldown by nearly 10%, which is a great beginning. However, it is recommended to upgrade the toppings as far as possible. It's worth mentioning that if you use a Swift Chocolate Topping Tart, the cooldown reduction will receive an extra 4% buff.

Searing Raspberry And Swift Chocolate Build

Although the amount of damage that Pure Vanilla deals to enemies is almost negligible, this cookie's ATK stat is actually important as it is a factor for the amount of healing he can afford.

Going back to the cookie's primary skill, his healing equals 112% of ATK. So, increasing the attack will also result in a higher amount of healing granted to other cookies in the squad. That's why Searing Raspberry turns into a crucial topping for Pure Vanilla, especially for high-level squads.

That being said, Swift Chocolate is still quite important, and ditching it entirely for the sake of Searing Raspberry wouldn't be a wise idea. So, it's recommended that players choose a Searing Raspberry Topping Tart along with 3 toppings of the same flavor, and then add two Swift Chocolate toppings to the remaining slots.

Assuming that all toppings are Epic, this will grant an almost 10% cooldown reduction as well as nearly 35% increase in ATK, which will then translate into extra healing. The good news is that ATK can still be further increased by equipping a beascuit and upgrading it.

Optimizing Pure Vanilla Cookie's Power

Naturally, Cookie Run Kingdom players should be aware of what Beascuits are, and the benefit of their incredible powers. Beascuits are attachable accessories that grant boosts to certain stats, putting a priority on the type of cookie it associates with. For Pure Vanilla Cookie's sake, a Legendary-level Beascuit will receive a larger boost to his HP, and sub-stats will focus on DMG Resist and other viable stats that make him stronger in the long run. Since his ATK and CRIT% don't matter too much, it's best to find sub-stats that boost his resistances and cooldown.

Finally, a good offense is always a good defense, and having one Defense cookie of Super Epic or higher rarity will be enough to make a team near indestructible. Ideally, players should have either Crimson Coral Cookie or Elder Faerie Cookie on the team, while the Ancient Hollyberry still stands the test of time as a suitable ally. For those unlucky enough to land one of these gems, Kouign-Aman Cookie and Madeleine Cookie are acceptable substitutions.

Pairing Pure Vanilla with Wind Archer in the rear line is a winning combination, as they come as two opposite roles in the squad, one focused solely on dealing damage, while the other only concentrating on healing the teammates. However, they are both at a safe distance from the enemy and can accomplish their job perfectly.

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows Fan Shows Off Naoe Cosplay
item.description:
Summary

  • Cosplayer recreates Naoe from Assassin's Creed Shadows, earning community praise for realism.
  • Naoe is a lethal ninja with a Hidden Blade, adding versatility in stealth and combat.
  • Cosplayer has also brought to life characters from Final Fantasy and Resident Evil, sparking admiration.

An Assassin's Creed Shadows fan has put together a cosplay of Naoe, earning praise from the community. Their cosplay reproduces the outfit the Assassin's Creed Shadows protagonist often appears wearing in promotional images.

Ubisoft has spiced up the iconic franchise by introducing two protagonists in Assassin's Creed Shadows . One is Yasuke, a samurai who served the warlord Oda Nobunaga. Living up to his title, he is a robust and powerful character who wears imposing black armor with gold and red details and wields a long katana. His counterpart is Naoe, a young ninja who wears lighter equipment but proves just as lethal on the battlefield. Now, one cosplayer has gone the extra mile, creating her own rendition of Naoe.

On Reddit, user Tanukiicos shared an image of her Naoe cosplay. The photo shows her recreation of the deep blue robe worn by the Assassin's Creed Shadows character, including the iconic red sash. The cosplayer incorporated into the attire some kunai attached to her leg, and a katana that appears in the background, reproducing parts of the arsenal that the ninja uses during the game. The composition doesn't include the hood and mask, but it doesn't give up the iconic Hidden Blade, which, according to her Instagram post, is functional.

Assassin's Creed Shadows Cosplayer Dresses as Naoe and Goes Viral on Reddit

Players used the comments section to praise the cosplayer's work, highlighting the striking resemblance to the ninja's equipment. Other fans praised the realism of the Hidden Blade she used, although comments noted that it is on the right arm instead of the left, a trademark feature of the Order of Assassins. The legendary weapon became less prominent in the Assassin's Creed games as they began to explore a more action-oriented gameplay. However, with the introduction of a more traditional assassin, the Hidden Blade used by Naoe takes on a more significant role. It gives the character the versatility to switch between stealth and combat, so she can perform assassinations and use it as a secondary weapon in battles.

This isn't the first time the cosplayer has attracted attention with her work, having previously brought to life other well-known characters from games such as Tifa from Final Fantasy 7 Remake , and Ada Wong from the Resident Evil series. Nor is this the first time the Assassin's Creed community has shared impressive cosplays, bringing to life other protagonists such as Arno Dorian from Assassin's Creed Unity and Bayek from Assassin's Creed Origins .
